resources.string: Required Accessibility Service to intercept long press power events. This service requests the minimum permissions required, and does not track or control your screen other than to show Classic Power Menu.
Intercepts the Power Menu to show Classic Power Menu, without needing the Accessibility Service.
Classic Power Menu requires root access, please root your device to continue

Classic Power Menu requires an Accessibility Service to react to Power Button events, please enable it to continue. Alternatively, if you have Xposed, you can enable the Xposed module and reboot. If you are using the Xposed module and still see this message, tap here to skip.

The Quick Access Wallet gives you access to your cards and passes, from your default payment app. You can switch between NFC enabled payment cards or access compatible passes, right from the power menu.\n\nAdditionally, Classic Power Menu supports Loyalty Cards, enable this later in the settings.
Device Controls allow you to control Smart Home devices via compatible apps, right from the power menu.\n\nAdditional apps are required to support this feature, such as Google Home.

One last thing: The first time you attempt to launch Classic Power Menu after installing or a reboot, the normal power menu may appear in front of Classic Power Menu, or Classic Power Menu may not launch at all. This is normal. Simply close the normal power menu and long press power again, and this time Classic Power Menu will launch as normal. This is due to Android System restrictions.\n\nEnjoy the app!
